page.title: 08A BUILDING SITE AT FAIRWATER
page.content: DURING 1985 WE WATCHED THE BUILDING OF SOME HOMES FOR THE DISABLED BEING BUILT AT FAIRWATER CLOSE.WE FOLLOWED THEIR PROGRESS FROM THE FOUNDATION TO THE FINISHED DWELLINGS.ON OUR VISITS WE WATCHED THE MEN AND MACHINES DOING LOTS OF DIFFERENT JOBS. LIKE BRICK LAYING AND PUTTING SLATES ON THE ROOF.WE SPOKE TO THE ARCHITECTS FROM CWMBRAN DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION ABOUT THE DESIGN OF THE BUILDING FOR DISABLED PEOPLE .THERE ARE RAMPS FOR WHEELCHAIRS AND KITCHENS THAT ARE EASY TO USE IF YOU ARE IN A WHEELCHAIR.THE SITE WAS CHOSEN BECAUSE IT WAS NEAR FAIRWATER SHOPS A LOCAL COMMUNITY CENTRE AND A CHURCH.SOME OF THE HOMES WILL BE FOR ABLE BODIED PEOPLE SO THAT THEY CAN HELP THEIR DISABLED NEIGHBOURS IF THEY ARE NEEDED.
